meanings.definition: A monetary unit equal to one hundredth of a peso in several Latin American countries.
meanings.sent1: In Mexico, you can buy a lot of candies with just one centavo.
meanings.sent2: I found a centavo on the street and used it to make a wish in the fountain.
meanings.sent3: The centavo rolled away from the piggy bank and went on an adventure around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a shiny centavo in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the centavo dropping into the jar echoed in the quiet room.

meanings.sent1: My grandma collects old coins, and she has a rare centavo from the 1800s.
meanings.sent2: I used a centavo to scratch off the lottery ticket and won a small prize.
meanings.sent3: The centavo in my pocket felt like a lucky charm, bringing me good fortune.
meanings.sent4: The beggar's eyes lit up when I dropped a centavo into his cup.
meanings.sent5: The shiny centavo gleamed among the dull coins in the jar.
